messages.subject: Re: Bad language
messages.msgSnippet: ... I may be way too immune to bad language (I was reared on George Carlin albums) to be objective on this, but IMHO neither you nor Shyrley nor anyone else in
messages.messageBody:
----------
>From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2944
>Date: Mon, Jan 27, 2003, 2:42 PM
>

> The list of things Americans don't say did get too rough. Sorry.
> I'd like to blame Shyrley because she's English and she asked the question,
> but
> I didn't tone down my response. Sorry.


I may be way too immune to bad language (I was reared on George Carlin
albums) to be objective on this, but IMHO neither you nor Shyrley nor anyone
else in the discussion has anything to apologize for (except maybe out of
kindness for inadvertantly stomping all over sensibilities, but STILL...
nah.)

This is a discussion, interesting to some and no doubt not to others, on an
adult mailing list. If it's so awful people feel the need to unsubscribe, I
feel for their state of mind as they go through everyday life in this wicked
world.

Just skip the thread if you find it boring or offensive. Heaven (no pun
intented) knows religion posts put MY teeth to sleep and I get myself over
it.

Pam, tetchy
